item.title: Geoportal INSAI
item.description:
The Geoportal INSAI was conceived as a tool to leverage the national plant protection and animal health system in Venezuela. It was based on open-source software, using MapServer for publishing geospatial data, in conjunction with i3Geo, which is an application for developing interactive web maps.

Geoportal INSAI displayed several predefined web map interfaces: regions, INSAI's offices, transit permits, epidemiology reports, and so on. Equally, it was possible that a user could create his own map and make spatial analysis directly on the web.

Unfortunately, this geoportal is currently offline. However, you can obtain more information about this project from the gvSIG association by clicking here and here.

item.title: Mining Geoportal
item.description:
The main goal of the Mining Geoportal (GeoMiNa) is to serve as a central repository for all data related to mining activities in Venezuela. GeoMiNa is a free and open data resource intended to support public and private management in the mining sector, as well as a means to exchange data between stakeholders. GeoMiNaâ€™s users will be the staff of the Mining Ministry (MPPDME) and the Institute for Geology and Mining (INGEOMIN), who will use the data for mining research and planning in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela.

Link: http://sigminas.desarrollominero.gob.ve
